Dear All,

continuing with the zero-divisor discussion, I have just added to #15983 a proof that if the grading type of an add monoid aalgebra is a right-ordered group, then the algebra itself has no non-zero zero-divisors (assuming of course that the base ring has no non-zero zero-divisors!).

If anyone has any comments, I'd be happy to hear them!

I can also split the two PR in two: the old proof and the new one are independent of one another.

Thanks!

In case someone wants to look at only the results with left/right ordered grading types, I broke off #16299 from #15983. The two PR are really independent, except that since they both introduce the "same" new file, I do not know how to actually make them independent! :smile:
